intro: Sida periplocifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Sida periplocifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
